title: Michael Flynn's next hearing is postponed as his attorney claims he is INNOCENT
text:
The federal judge presiding over former National Security Advisor Michael Flynn's case has canceled next week's hearing on the heels of Flynn's attorney claiming he's innocent.

U.S. District Judge Emmet Sullivan announced the Nov. 7 hearing would be postponed Tuesday after a lawyer for Flynn filed a motion Thursday saying Flynn was the victim of 'outrageous government misconduct,' including at the hands of FBI lovers Peter Strzok and Lisa Page.

Flynn's lawyer Sidney Powell argued that the FBI agents who interviewed Flynn - which included Strzok in the initial sitting - had manipulated the forms used by agents to summarize what was said. The form, called a 302, was edited by Lisa Page, Powell claimed, linking both FBI lovers to the 'ambush.'

Michael Flynn's next hearing, which was set for next week, was delayed Tuesday on the heels of his attorney filing new documents in an attempt to prove his innocence

Michael Flynn's lawyer Sidney Powell (left) filed documents Thursday claiming Flynn (right) was innocent and that interview notes from the FBI were manipulated

Michael Flynn's lawyer quoted FBI lovers Peter Strzok (left) and Lisa Page (right) in the fresh filings

Michael Flynn pleaded guilty of lying to the FBI in 2017, but his attorney now says the FBI manipulated the interview documents to suggest something Flynn never definitively said

Flynn pleaded guilty to lying to the FBI in 2017.

He admitted to saying that he hadn't spoken to former Russian Ambassador Sergey Kislyak, when Special Counsel Robert Mueller's investigation found that he did.

But Powell now argues that Flynn said he wasn't sure he had spoken to Kislyak instead of saying a definitive no.

'This is a deceptive manipulation because, as the notes of the agents show, Mr. Flynn was not even sure he had spoken to Russia/Kislyak on the issue. He had talked to dozens of countries,' Powell's fresh court filing said.

Powell's brief also quoted texts between Strzok and his then-lover Lisa Page, an FBI lawyer.

After the release of the so-called dirty dossier, Strzok and Page had texted, with Strzok wondering if the dossier's public release could be used as a reason to interview more people for the open Russia case.

Strzok then met with former deputy FBI Director Andrew McCabe to talk about interviewing Flynn.

Powell then alleged that 'the upper echelon of the FBI met to orchestrate' the Flynn interview in 'such a way as to keep from alerting him from understanding that he was being interviewed in a criminal investigation of which he was the target.'

'In short, they planned to deceive him about the entire scenario, and keep him "unguarded,"' Powell said.

Powell's court documents also go after Strzok and Page for texting about coordinated media leaks and accuse former Director of National Intelligence James Clapper of ordering a media hit on Flynn courtesy of Washington Post reporter David Ignatius.

Powell claimed that Clapper had told Ignatius to 'take the kill shot on Flynn' after the reporter got copies of the transcripts of Flynn's phone calls with Kislyak.

Clapper told Fox News that he 'absolutely did not say those words to David Ignatius.'

Prosecutors involved in the case called Flynn's claim of innocence 'an extraordinary reversal.'

'He makes this claim despite having admitted his guilt, under oath, before two federal judges,' prosecutors said Tuesday.

Sullivan had set a December 18 sentencing date, though that could be delayed as well.
description: The federal judge presiding over former National Security Advisor Michael Flynn's case has canceled next week's hearing on the heels of Flynn's attorney claiming he's innocent.
authors: Senior U.S. Political Reporter For Dailymail.Com
